properties.areaDesc: Olomana; Waianae Coast; Kauai Windward; Maui Windward West; Maui Central Valley; Windward Haleakala; Molokai Leeward; Oahu North Shore; Oahu Koolau; Niihau; Kauai Leeward; Molokai Windward
properties.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 29 at 3:18AM HST until January 30 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu HI
properties.description:
...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU
KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI...

.A dangerous long-period northwest swell will spread down the
island chain today and tonight and hold through Thursday.

* WHAT...Surf will be 18 to 23 feet along north and west facing
shores of Niihau and Kauai. Surf will be 15 to 20 feet along the
north facing shores of Oahu, Molokai and Maui. Along west
facing shores of Oahu and Molokai, surf will be 10 to 15 feet.

* WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu,
Molokai and north facing shores of Maui.

* WHEN...Through 6 AM HST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect strong breaking waves, shore break,
and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming
difficult and dangerous.
properties.instruction:
Beachgoers, swimmers, and surfers should heed all advice given by
ocean safety officials and exercise caution.

Boaters should expect recreational surfers and body boarders
utilizing harbor channels to access surfing areas.

NWSheadline: HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST THURSDAY
